title: Ticket #3030: JobRouter should be able to route between multiple schedd's
description:
For the Condor-CE, it would be very useful if the JobRouter could route between two schedd's on the same host.

Having everything run in one schedd is difficult because:

  • Writing a generic authz policy that merges the local authz and the remote authz is difficult to automate.
  • Creating a merged condor_mapfile and GSI_AUTHZ_CONF may not be possible from a packaging standpoint.
  • Detecting the location of the local site's configuration files so we can reliably "drop in" configs (as there are a huge number of variations of what sites have setup).
  • Sites will be eager to hard separate "nasty grid users" from their local schedd. The site may not want to expose their main collector / schedd to remote users to prevent against denial of service attacks.

Dan has provided me with a draft patch that I've been using. The biggest known issue is that SuperUserAllowedToSetOwnerTo in qmgmt.cpp prevents the JobRouter from submitting jobs for users that have not run directly.
remarks:
2012-Jun-13 17:17:18 by danb:
I attached a patch that adds a new config knob QUEUE_SUPER_USER_MAY_IMPERSONATE. It is a regular expression that matches the owner names the queue super user is allowed to impersonate. It could be set to .* in the config of the target schedd to allow routing of jobs owned by anyone.

2012-Jul-13 14:56:50 by danb:
The two-schedd mode has been committed to the trunk. This ticket may be resolved, but I'll leave it in review status in case Zach wants to check over the security-related QUEUE_SUPER_USER_MAY_IMPERSONATE patch, which is needed for two-schedd routing.
